name: Ernst Loof
introduction: Ernst Loof (born 4 July 1907 and died 3 March 1956) was a German engineer, racing driver and co-founder of Veritas. He participated in the 1953 German Grand Prix using a privately entered Veritas, but his fuel pump failed after only two meters of racing. Some sources record Loof as having the undesirable record of the shortest F1 career, while others continue to attribute that record to Marco Apicella.
